title: Frequent websocket connection drops on higher (default 30s) ping_interval

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

body:
### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [x] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [x] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

Since the last update from Streamlit 1.45.1 (Tornado 6.4.2) to 1.47.0 (Tornado 6.5.1) my users reported very frequent (say every half a minute) grey-outs of the pages/elements. Upon further inspection it seems that the websocket connection was often considered closed.

The cause seems to lie in the `ping_timeout` saga (https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/3196, https://github.com/tornadoweb/tornado/pull/3376, https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/11670).

Forcing Tornado to 6.4.2 (while still keeping streamlit on 1.47.0) solves the issue because the conditional sets the `websocket_ping_interval` to 1s again. We run Streamlit in a Docker container with Nginx, so a proxy setup applies.

### Reproducible Code Example

```Python
n/a
```

### Steps To Reproduce

Streamlit 1.47.0 in a Docker container with Nginx

### Expected Behavior

Stability with a higher `websocket_ping_interval` server setting (e.g. 30s).
Allowing for more recent versions of Tornado (> 6.4.2) to be used.

### Current Behavior

Streamlit instability with a higher `websocket_ping_interval` server setting

### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.47.0
- Tornado version: 6.5.1
- Python version: 3.12.5
- Operating System: Linux


### Additional Information

Originally this Streamlit issue https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/3196 was reported and solved/merged with `"websocket_ping_interval": 1` on 23 jun 2021.

A recent Tornado issue on https://github.com/tornadoweb/tornado/pull/3376 came to disallow the `websocket_ping_interval` to be below the `websocket_ping_timeout` of 30s. This update was merged/released on 22 april 2025 (Tornado 6.5.1). 

The Tornado update - allowing the `websocket_ping_interval` gave trouble to some Streamlit users, reported 17 jun 2025: https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/11670. This Streamlit issue was eventually solved by the current code: `"websocket_ping_interval": 1 if is_tornado_version_less_than("6.5.0") else 30,`
With the update, @lukasmasuch remarked: `This could potentially bring back an old issue with dropping connections in specific proxy setups - #3196. Something we need to watch out for after this gets released.`

It seems our Streamlit setup is suffering from this regression. Forcing Tornado to 6.4.2 (while still keeping streamlit on 1.47.0) solves the issue because the conditional sets the `websocket_ping_interval` to 1s again.
